      • m_Sigma

        private double m_Sigma
        >= 0, see m_NeighbourWeights, m_Sigma == 0 <=> {@link #m_WeightNeighbours} == false

      • m_NeighbourWeights

        private double[] m_NeighbourWeights
        Weights for the contributions of the nearest neighbours. Value on the i-th place is exp((- m_Sigma * i)^2).

        private boolean[] m_IsStandardClassification

      • m_NbTargetValues

        private int[] m_NbTargetValues
        m_NbTargetValues[index]: if {link #m_IsStandardClassification}[index]: the number of classes, for the target with index index, otherwise: 1.

      • m_TargetProbabilities

        private double[][] m_TargetProbabilities
        m_TargetProbabilities[index]: relative frequencies of the target values, used in standard classification, for the target with the index of index - 1 if index > 0, and overall target otherwise.
        If not m_IsStandardClassification[index], then m_TargetProbabilities[index] = null.

      • m_PerformPerTargetRanking

        private boolean m_PerformPerTargetRanking
        tells, whether to perform per-target rankings also

      • m_SumDistAttr

        private double[][][] m_SumDistAttr
        m_SumDistAttr[target index][number of neighbours][attribute]: current sum of distances between attribute values, for the given number of neighbours and attribute. If target index is 0, this is for overall ranking(s). Otherwise, this is for the ranking(s) for the target with the index target index - 1.

      • m_SumDistTarget

        private double[][] m_SumDistTarget
        m_SumDistAttr[target index][number of neighbours]: for the given number of neighbours , this is an analogue of m_SumDistAttr for the distances between target values.

      • m_SumDistAttrTarget

        private double[][][] m_SumDistAttrTarget
        m_SumDistAttr[target index][number of neighbours][attribute]: the analogue of m_SumDistAttr, for the products of distances between attribute values and distances between target values

      • m_NearestNeighbours

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,NearestNeighbour[][]>> m_NearestNeighbours
        m_NearestNeighbours[target index][tuple index]: the nearest neighbours for a given tuple as returned by #findNearestNeighbours(int, RowData, int, boolean).

        If target index = -1, these are the neighbours used in the computation of the overall ranking(s). Otherwise, these are the neighbours used in the computations of the ranking(s) for target with the index target index.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClusReliefFeatureRanking

        public ClusReliefFeatureRanking(RowData data,
                                int[] neighbours,
                                int[] iterations,
                                boolean weightNeighbours,
                                double sigma,
                                int seed,
                                Settings sett)
        Constructor for the ClusReliefFeatureRanking, with the standard parameters of (R)Relief(F).
        Parameters:
        neighbours - The number of neighbours that is used in the feature importance calculation. Constraints:

        0 < neighbours <= number of instances in the dataset

        iterations - The number of iterations in the feature importance calculation. Constraints:

        0 < iterations <= number of instances in the dataset

        weightNeighbours - If weightNeighbours, then the contribution of the i-th nearest neighbour in the feature importance calculation are weighted with factor exp((- sigma * i) ** 2).
        sigma - The rate of quadratic exponential decay. Note that Weka's sigma is the inverse of our sigma.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        Initialises some fields etc.
        Parameters:

      • setNbFeatureRankings

        private void setNbFeatureRankings()
        Computes and sets the number of feature rankings to be performed.

      • rankingIndex

        private int rankingIndex(int iterationsIndex,
                         int neighboursIndex,
                         int targetIndex)
        Returns the index of the (per-target) ranking, computed with specified number of iterations, neighbours and target index. Greater or equal to zero.
        Parameters:
        iterationsIndex - The index of the number of iterations in m_NbIterations
        neighboursIndex - The index of the number of neighbours in #m_NbNeighnours
        targetIndex - If non-negative, then this is the index of the target and we are looking for a index of a per-target ranking. If -1, then we are looking for the index of the overall ranking.

      • computeReliefImportance

        public void computeReliefImportance(RowData data)
                             throws ClusException,
                                    java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                    java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException,
                                    java.io.IOException
        Calculates the feature importances for a given dataset.
        Parameters:
        data - The dataset, whose features are importances calculated for.

        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException

      • updateImportances

        private void updateImportances(RowData data,
                               int numIterInd,
                               double[] successfulItearions,
                               boolean[] shouldUpdate)
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Updates the importances of the attributes. It is called when the current number of iterations is the element of m_NbIterations.
        Parameters:
        data - The dataset under consideration.
        numIterInd - m_NbIterations[numIterInd] equals the current number of iterations
        successfulItearions - successfulItearions[target + 1] equals the number of successful overall (if target = -1) or per-target (for the target with index target) iterations.

        Due to the missing values, some of these may not equal m_NbIterations[numIterInd].

        shouldUpdate - Tells, whether the given overall/per-target ranking statistics should be updated. Has the same structure as successfulItearions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • updateDistanceStatistics

        private int updateDistanceStatistics(RowData data,
                                     DataTuple tuple,
                                     NearestNeighbour[][] nearestNeighbours,

      • computeStandardClassification

        private boolean[] computeStandardClassification()

      • nbTargetValues

        private int[] nbTargetValues()

      • nominalClassCounts

        private double[] nominalClassCounts(int nominalTargetIndex)
        Computes normalised counts of each class value, for a given target.
        Parameters:
        nominalTargetIndex - if -1, this is the overall ranking, hence STC is the task at hand. Otherwise, we are computing statistics that are used in per-target ranking.
        Returns:
        A list with number of examples with a particular value of the target. In the last place, we have the number of examples whose value of the target is missing. The counts for non-missing values are normalised by the number of examples with non-missing value for the target.

      • findNearestNeighbours

        public NearestNeighbour[][] findNearestNeighbours(int tupleInd,
                                                  int targetIndex)
                                           throws ClusException,
                                                  java.lang.InterruptedException
        Computes the nearest neighbours of example with index tupleInd in the dataset.
        Parameters:
        tupleInd - Row index of the example in the dataset data, whose nearest neighbours are computed.
        Returns:
        An array of m_NbTargetValues arrays of NearestNeighbours. Each of the arrays belongs to one target value and is sorted decreasingly with respect to the distance(neighbour, considered tuple).
        Throws:
        ClusException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • computeDistance

        public double computeDistance(DataTuple t1,
                              DataTuple t2,
                              int space)
                       throws ClusException
        Distance between tuples in the subspace space.
        Parameters:
        t1 - The first tuple
        t2 - The second tuple
        space - 0 or 1; if 0, subspace is descriptive space and target space otherwise.
        Returns:
        Distance between t1 and t2 in the given subspace.
        Throws:
        ClusException

      • computeDistance1D

        public double computeDistance1D(DataTuple t1,
                                DataTuple t2,
                                ClusAttrType attr)
                         throws ClusException
        Calculates the distance between to tuples in a given component attr.
        Parameters:
        t1 - The first tuple
        t2 - The second tuple
        attr - The attribute/dimension in which the distance between t1 and t2 is computed.
        Returns:
        distance(attr.value(t1), attr.value(t2))
        Throws:
        ClusException

      • computeNominalDist1D

        public double computeNominalDist1D(DataTuple t1,
                                   DataTuple t2,
                                   NominalAttrType attr)
        Calculates distance between the nominal values of the component attr. In the case of missing values, we follow Weka's solution and not the paper Theoretical and Empirical Analysis of ReliefF and RReliefF, by Robnik Sikonja and Kononenko (time complexity ...).
        Parameters:
        t1 - The first tuple
        t2 - The second tuple
        attr - The nominal attribute/dimension in which the distance between t1 and t2 is computed.
        Returns:
        distance(attr.value(t1), attr.value(t2))

      • computeNumericDist1D

        public double computeNumericDist1D(DataTuple t1,
                                   DataTuple t2,
                                   NumericAttrType attr,
                                   double normalizationFactor)
        Calculates distance between the numeric values of the component attr. In the case of missing values, we follow Weka's solution and not the paper Theoretical and Empirical Analysis of ReliefF and RReliefF, by Robnik Sikonja and Kononenko (time complexity ...).
        Parameters:
        t1 - The first tuple
        t2 - The second tuple
        attr - The numeric attribute/dimension in which the distance between t1 and t2 is computed.
        normalizationFactor - Typically,

        normalizationFactor = 1 / (m_numMaxs[attr.name()] - m_numMins[attr.name()]).

        Returns:
        If v1 and v2 are the numeric values of the attribute attr for the instances t1 and t2, the value

        |v1 - v2| / normalizationFactor

        is returned.

      • computeHierarchicalDist1D

        public double computeHierarchicalDist1D(DataTuple t1,
                                        DataTuple t2,
                                        ClassesAttrType attr)
        Calculates the distance between hierarchical sets of labels of data tuples t1 and t2.
        Parameters:
        t1 -
        t2 -
        attr -

      • computeTimeSeriesDist1D

                                      DataTuple t2,
                                      TimeSeriesAttrType attr)
                               throws ClusException
        Computes distance between the time series values of the component attr.
        Parameters:

        t2 - The second tuple

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • computeStringDist1D

        public double computeStringDist1D(DataTuple t1,
                                  DataTuple t2,
                                  StringAttrType attr)
        Computes Levenshtein's distance between the string values of the component attr.
        Parameters:
        t1 - The first tuple
        t2 - The second tuple
        attr - The string attribute/dimension in which the distance between t1 and t2 is computed.
        Returns:
        Levenshtein distance between attr.value(t1) and attr.value(t2).

      • randomPermutation

        private int[] randomPermutation(int examples)
        Computes a random permutation with FisherÂ–Yates algorithm.
        Parameters:
        examples - The number of examples that we will place in a random order. *
        Returns:
        A permutation given as a list whose i-th element is the index of the example that is processed in i-th iteration.

        private void computeNearestNeighbours(int[] randomPermutation)
                               throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                      java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException,
                                      java.io.IOException,
                                      ClusException
        Computes (or loads) all nearest neighbours in advance, i.e., before the main iterative part of Relief. Updates the field m_NearestNeighbours accordingly.
        Parameters:
        randomPermutation - the order in which the instances will be used in the Relief algorithm.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        java.io.IOException
        ClusException
